metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2207 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
pt_chown in GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.18 does notproperly check permissions for tty files, which allows local users tochange the permission on the files and obtain access to arbitrarypseudo-terminals by leveraging a FUSE file system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.8').
